In addition, member stations must pay postage both ways on tapes shipped
to and from the Network. For a station in your area this would amount
to approximately $27.50 a year if you availed yourself of all the pro¬
grams made available by the Network. (There is a strong possibility that
there will soon be Congressional action to lower rates for educational
recordings, which would make postage payments considerably lower.) Even
with the postage charges you see that the cost per hour of programming
(for 400 hours, or more) is very low.
In addition to the regular Network service described above (a sample Net¬
work offering is included in the material being sent separately), we make
available in-school programs to those stations who do in-school broadcasting.
For this service a station pays an additional fee of one-fourth of the
regular assessment, or $2.00 per real, whichever is less. However, since
many in-school stations are not on the air during the stunner months, such
stations are allowed to substitute the in-school programs for regular pro¬
grams they would receive during the summer, and thus pay no additional fee
for the in-school service.
Regarding your request for the name of a consulting engineering firm to help
in filing your application with FCC, we are suggesting the following since
they are geographically closer to you. This may mean a savings since no
doubt travel to Walnut Ridge would be involved. The firms are:
A. Earl Cullum, Jr. Everett L. Hillard
Inwood Post Office Comnercial Radio Equipment Co.
Dallas 9, Texas P.0. Box 7037
Kansas City, Missouri
Both of the above firms are members of the Association of FCC Consulting
Engineers. We Suggest that you write to them for an estimate of their
charges for the services you require. If you would prefer someone located
in Washington, D. C, we refer you to the Broadcasting-Telecasting Yearbook
or the Professional Directory of any issue of this magazine.
If, after you’ve had an opportunity to look over the materials I’m send¬
ing, you have any questions about the NAEB, please let me know, and we’re
looking forward to the opportunity of serving you.
